channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8179] JSON formatting for cluster status is sort of broken
item.description: In our testing on the REST side of things, we discovered that the request curl -H "Accept: application/json" http://localhost:8080/status/cluster" gets a JSON that collapses the node-list array into one node-element (can see if there are more than 1 RS in the cluster).
item.summary: JSON formatting for cluster status is sort of broken

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Majority of issues filed against REST is due to the Jersey JSON JAXB bindings. Perhaps the best course of action is to deprecate the current JSON representation and reimplement with Jackson.
This patch solves the problem, at least for the case reported in this jira.

Perhaps the best course of action is to deprecate the current JSON representation and reimplement with Jackson

Hmm.. Andrew, do you mind looking at the patch and see if it makes sense for the short term at least. The patch improves the current situation.

The patch improves the current situation.

The patch changes the JAXB mapping for JSON globally. How does the JSON formatting look for other cases? Do you happen have REST JSON clients doing other things as part of this testing? Do they break?

How does the JSON formatting look for other cases? Do you happen have REST JSON clients doing other things as part of this testing?

Let me find this out from the guys involved in the testing. BTW if there is a way to affect this change only for the status/cluster servlet/request, that'd work as well.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12575104/8179-1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.

Okay this patch limits the change to only the path /status/cluster on which the problem exists. The fix may not be the best fix but it works to address the problem at hand. Am open to other suggestions.

Okay this patch limits the change to only the path /status/cluster on which the problem exists.

+1 on v2 patch.

This isn't a bad way to see (incrementally) if this mapping will help other issues with JSON formatting which might be reported without risk of changing something unrelated unexpectedly.
Patch v2 looks good.

We want to be able to treat the node list as POJO but not everything.

I'm loving the comment explaining what's going on, right up until the end of this sentence. "but not everything" doesn't make any sense to me. Would you mind being a little more explicit in your explanation, for the sake of posterity.

Otherwise, I'm +1 on the implementation in v2.
Takes into account Nick's comment.
